page.title: 09INTERVIEW WITH A FISHERMAN
page.content: "FISHING IS NOT A JOB BUT A WAY OF LIFE" SAYS ALEXANDER MURRAY COULL SKIPPER OF THE BUCKIE REGISTERED BOAT SPINDRIFT BCK1. THE FOUR MAN CREW FISH FROM LOCHINVER, SUTHERLAND OR BLYTH, NORTHUMBERLAND. THEY WEAR OILSKINS AND WARM WOOLLIES WHEN THEY GO ON THEIR FISHING TRIPS. THE DAILY ROUTINE IS TO LEAVE THE HARBOUR AND FISH FOR UP TO 16 HOURS FROM 3 TOWS OR 4 TOWS DEPENDING ON THE DAYLIGHT. THE NETS USED ARE BOBBIN TRAWLS AND CLEAN NET TRAWLS. EXPERIENCE AND THE USE OF CHARTS HELPED BY MODERN EQUIPMENT SUCH AS ECHOMETERS, DECCA, METERS AND PLOTTERS TELL OF THE FISHING AREAS. WHEN THE WEEKLY CATCH IS MADE (20-90 BOXES OF PRAWNS), THEY ARE SOLD ON THE MARKET. THE PRICE VARIES WITH DEMAND. {BY MICHAEL COULL.
